subject: Re: Shared data between test methods in a testcase
msgSnippet: This code below makes sense, but doesn t it require that all of the methods called in the oneTimeSetUp() and oneTimeTearDown() methods are all static?  I have
messageBody:
This code below makes sense, but doesn't it require that all of the
methods called in the oneTimeSetUp() and oneTimeTearDown() methods
are all static? I have many methods that I need to call in
oneTimeSetUp() and oneTimeTearDown() that are not static. Any
suggestions?

thanks,
chad.

>>>>>
there is one way to do a one time setup and tearDown in a test
class,here is how:

public class TestOne extends TestCase

{

public static void oneTimeSetUp()
{
System.out.println("test set up ");
}

public static void oneTimeTearDown()
{
System.out.println("test tear down ");
}

public void test1()
{
System.out.println("test1");
}

public void test2()
{
System.out.println("test2");
}
public static Test suite()
{
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite(TestOne.class);

TestSetup wrapper= new TestSetup(suite)
{
public void setUp()
{
oneTimeSetUp();
}
public void tearDown()
{
oneTimeTearDown()

}
};
return wrapper;

}

run this class you can see setup is done in the first order,and
teardown is the last one.

and if you specify the order to exe the test case,you can share data
as you want.
>>

Ellen
